content.full_text: Abraham Lincoln to George W. Shaw, 27 July 18561 Your letter of the 23rdis received–2I have promised to be atMount-Morris, inOgle Co, on the 16thof of Augt & on the 18th& 19that other places in that vicinity— so that I could not be atPekinon the 20th3Send over and getJudge Kellogg, who, I understand, is to be, or already is, your candidate forCongress– He will do it up quite as well as I could–4 Show this toJudge Bush; and beg him to consider it an answer to his letter as well as yours–5
paragraphs: Abraham Lincoln to George W. Shaw, 27 July 18561 Your letter of the 23rdis received–2I have promised to be atMount-Morris, inOgle Co, on the 16thof of Augt & on the 18th& 19that other places in that vicinity— so that I could not be atPekinon the 20th3Send over and getJudge Kellogg, who, I understand, is to be, or already is, your candidate forCongress– He will do it up quite as well as I could–4 Show this toJudge Bush; and beg him to consider it an answer to his letter as well as yours–5
citations: Roy P. Basler and Christian O. Basler, eds.,The Collected Works of Abraham Lincoln(New Brunswick, NJ: Rutgers University Press, 1990), 11:8-9; Michael Burlingame,Abraham Lincoln: A Life(Baltimore: The Johns Hopkins University Press, 2008), 1:426.

The Lincoln Log: A Daily Chronology of the Life of Abraham Lincoln, 15 August 1856,http://thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1856-08-15, 16 August 1856,http://thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1856-08-16; 17 August 1856,http://thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1856-08-17; 18 August 1856,http://thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1856-08-18; 19 August 1856,http://thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1856-08-19; 21 August 1856,http://thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1856-08-21; 26 August 1856,http://thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1856-08-26.

Daily Illinois State Journal(Springfield), 11 August 1856, 3:1; Howard W. Allen and Vincent A. Lacey, eds.,Illinois Elections, 1818-1990(Carbondale and Edwardsville: Southern Illinois University Press, 1992), 10.
Howard W. Allen and Vincent A. Lacey, eds.,Illinois Elections, 1818-1990, 10, 140.

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln wrote and signed this letter.Roy P. Basler, editor ofThe Collected Works of Abraham Lincoln, incorrectly dated this letter July 27, 1854. The content of the letter, including
                  Lincoln’s discussion of canvassing throughoutIllinoison behalf of theRepublican Partyin advance of the1856 Federal Election, confirms that Lincoln wrote this letter in 1856, not 1854. Basler did not review
                  the original letter; he created his annotations using a facsimile.Roy P. Basler and Christian O. Basler, eds.,The Collected Works of Abraham Lincoln(New Brunswick, NJ: Rutgers University Press, 1990), 11:8-9; Michael Burlingame,Abraham Lincoln: A Life(Baltimore: The Johns Hopkins University Press, 2008), 1:426.
2George W. Shaw’s July 23, 1856, letter to Lincoln has not been located.

3Lincoln arrived inPolo, Illinoisin Ogle County on August 15, 1856, traveled toOregon, Illinoisto speak the next day, returned to Polo, and arrived home in Springfield, Illinois
                  on August 18. He remained in Springfield until at least August 21, but, by August
                  26, he was traveling again—this time to speak inChicago, Illinois.The Lincoln Log: A Daily Chronology of the Life of Abraham Lincoln, 15 August 1856,http://thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1856-08-15, 16 August 1856,http://thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1856-08-16; 17 August 1856,http://thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1856-08-17; 18 August 1856,http://thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1856-08-18; 19 August 1856,http://thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1856-08-19; 21 August 1856,http://thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1856-08-21; 26 August 1856,http://thelincolnlog.org/Results.aspx?type=CalendarDay&day=1856-08-26.

4In 1856, William Kellogg ran for a seat in theU.S. House of Representativesas the Republican Party’s candidate in Illinois’ Fourth Congressional District.DemocratJames W. Davidsonwas his opponent.Daily Illinois State Journal(Springfield), 11 August 1856, 3:1; Howard W. Allen and Vincent A. Lacey, eds.,Illinois Elections, 1818-1990(Carbondale and Edwardsville: Southern Illinois University Press, 1992), 10.

5John M. Bush’s letter to Lincoln has not been located.There is no evidence that Kellogg delivered a public address in Pekin, Illinois on
                  August 20, 1856.Voters in Illinois’ Fourth Congressional District sent Kellogg to the U.S. House of
                  Representatives, awarding him 51.1 percent of the vote to Davidson’s 45.7 percent.
                  WithinTazewell County, however, voters gave Davidson  a healthy majority, awarding him 52.5 percent of
                  the county’s vote to Kellogg’s 42 percent.Howard W. Allen and Vincent A. Lacey, eds.,Illinois Elections, 1818-1990, 10, 140.

structured_content.text: Abraham Lincoln to George W. Shaw, 27 July 18561

Your letter of the 23rdis received–2I have promised to be atMount-Morris, inOgle Co, on the 16thof of Augt[August] & on the 18th& 19that other places in that vicinity— so that I could not be atPekinon the 20th3Send over and getJudge Kellogg, who, I understand, is to be, or already is, your candidate forCongress–  He will do it up quite as well as I could–4
Show this toJudge Bush; and beg him to consider it an answer to his letter as well as yours–5
